Instruction: Trim the ends of the green beans and blanch them in boiling water for 2-3 minutes, then immediately transfer them to a bowl of ice water to stop the cooking process.
In a small bowl, whisk together orange juice, soy sauce, honey, minced ginger, and minced garlic.
In a separate small bowl, mix cornstarch and water to make a slurry.
Heat a skillet over medium heat and add the orange juice mixture.
Bring to a simmer and cook for 1-2 minutes, stirring constantly.
Add the cornstarch slurry to the skillet and continue to cook for another minute, or until the sauce thickens.
Add the blanched green beans to the skillet and toss to coat them in the glaze.
Cook for an additional 2-3 minutes, or until the green beans are heated through and well coated in the glaze.
Serve the orange ginger glazed green beans hot as a zesty and flavorful side dish.
